result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

04:13 PM Attorney Shanna Sanders in court by video. Alexander David Goulart appeared in person with intern Margaret Ginocchio by video for the State of Wisconsin. Per CC Hoag matter continued for Defendant to get proper notice.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Supervision Report

Activity:  Initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:44 PM Defendant Jeremy Wayne Hill in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Jason D Sanders by video.  David S Olson and intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Court sets Cash Bond of $500 with conditions:  Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No possession of drug paraphernalia. No driving.  Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 3:00 PM.
